noun.description: An explosive sound made by the sudden forcing of breath through one's nose, used to express indignation, derision, or incredulity.
examples: he gave a snort of disgust

verb.description: Make a sudden sound through one's nose, especially to express indignation or derision.

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb, also in the sense snore): probably imitative; compare with snore. The noun dates from the early 19th century.
